It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, thriving in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in its arid habitat. Helianthemum raskebdanae is a rare species, often found in specific microhabitats, making it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
